name: host
label: SMTP host
help_text: The host to use for sending email. Leave it blank if you want to use system environment - EMAIL_HOST.

name: port
label: SMTP port
help_text: Port to use for the SMTP server. Leave it blank if you want to use system environment - EMAIL_PORT.

name: username
label: SMTP user
help_text: Username to use for the SMTP server. Leave it blank if you want to use system environment - EMAIL_HOST_USER.

name: password
label: Password
help_text: Password to use for the SMTP server. Leave it blank if you want to use system environment - EMAIL_HOST_PASSWORD.

name: sender_name
label: Sender name
help_text: Name which will be visible as 'from' name.

name: sender_address
label: Sender email
help_text: Sender email which will be visible as 'from' email.

name: use_tls
label: Use TLS
help_text: Whether to use a TLS (secure) connection when talking to the SMTP server. This is used for explicit TLS connections, generally on port 587. Use TLS/Use SSL are mutually exclusive, so only set one of these settings to True. Leave it blank if you want to use system environment - EMAIL_USE_TLS.

name: use_ssl
label: Use SSL
help_text: Whether to use an implicit TLS (secure) connection when talking to the SMTP server. In most email documentation this type of TLS connection is referred to as SSL. It is generally used on port 465. Use TLS/Use SSL are mutually exclusive, so only set one of these settings to True. Leave it blank if you want to use system environment - EMAIL_USE_SSL.
